snippet.title: Quad Desert Fury - Game Boy Advance Gameplay
snippet.description:
Climb on to your ATV (all terrain vehicle) and race on seven desert tracks. You'll have to compete against three computer-controlled opponents and will need to avoid deep dunes, desert wells, sinkholes and even land mines.

There are two play modes: Quick Race and Challenge, which requires you to win a race on each track before moving onto the next one.

This budget GBA game didn't seem to be talked about back in 2003, as the only critic review (according to MobyGames) was from an old, short-lived website called EAGB Advance. They gave it 2/5 stars, but if you want to read the review yourself, I left the link below.

Over at GameFAQs, there's no recorded info on other critic reviews, but there was one user review from 2005 by badmonkey715. His review was much more harsh, giving it a painful 1/10.

Of course, creating 3D games on the Game Boy Advance, which is more suited for 2D games, are usually a gamble. Some work well, like Mario Kart: Super Circuit, Duke Nukem Advance or the GBA port of Crash Nitro Kart, some of them... not so much, like Star Wars: Flight of the Falcon, the GBA port of Medal of Honor: Underground and, well, this game.

Developed by Skyworks Technologies
Published by Majesco

EAGB Advance review: http://www.eagb.net/advance/gr211.html
badmonkey715's review: https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gba/918720-quad-desert-fury/reviews/87851

#retrogames #retrogaming #gba #gameboyadvance #gameboyadvancesp #gameboyadvance3d #gba3d #3dgameboygames #quaddesertfury #majesco #quad #quads
